alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 7:42AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Floyd and central Pike Counties through 830 AM EST... At 742 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Coal Run, or near Pikeville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Pikeville and Shelbiana around 745 AM EST. Zebulon, Raccoon, Meta, Chloe and Garden Village around 750 AM EST. Kimper and Varney around 755 AM EST. Canada, Sidney and Phyllis around 800 AM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Forest Hills, Mcandrews, Huddy, Hardy, Belfry, Aflex, Phelps, Board Tree, Jamboree, Coleman, Majestic, Argo and Woodman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
